definition: surname Yi/abbr. for 伊拉克[Yi1 la1 ke4], Iraq/abbr. for 伊朗[Yi1 lang3], Iran

(old) third person singular pronoun ("he" or "she")/second person singular pronoun ("you")/(May 4th period) third person singular feminine pronoun ("she")/(Classical Chinese) introductory particle with no specific meaning/that (preceding a noun)
to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]
non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])
background/bottom/base/end (of the month, year etc)/remnants/(math.) radix/base
see 方枘圓鑿|方枘圆凿[fang1 rui4 yuan2 zao2]
differing only slightly/not much between them
lit. try to straighten out silk threads only to tangle them further (idiom)/fig. to try to help but end up making things worse
to harm people and damage property (idiom)
lit. a caged bird in a pavilion (idiom); fig. to lose vigilance by comfortable living/unaware of the disasters ahead/a fool's paradise
